threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered miner. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET POLICY GNU/Linux APT User-Agent Outbound likely related to package management
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET POLICY GNU/Linux APT User-Agent Outbound likely related to package management"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"APT-HTTP|2F|"; reference:url,help.ubuntu.com/community/AptGet/Howto; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2013504; rev:6; metadata:created_at 2011_08_31, updated_at 2020_04_22;)

attributes.magic: Bourne-Again shell script, ASCII text executable, with very long lines (446u)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of utilities such as 'systemctl', 'service'...etc to stop or disable tools and services

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: User Added To Root/Sudoers Group Using Usermod
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of the "usermod" binary to add users add users to the root or suoders groups

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Group Has Been Deleted Via Groupdel
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of the "groupdel" binary. Which is used to delete a group. This is sometimes abused by threat actors in order to cover their tracks
Detects enumeration of local systeam accounts. This information can help adversaries determine which local accounts exist on a system to aid in follow-on behavior.
